We got our room early in the morning and it was nice, quiet, spacious and clean. Nothing to complain about the room or the service, only good things. It would have been nice if our price would have included breakfast. But I would recommend this hotel because we found it very relaxing and quiet by a lively street.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine, But Not Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: HonkHonk
Reviews.Content: The Concorde is clean, tidy, chic, modern, well designed, well maintained, professional, and functional. However, my non-club-level experience would not warrant the same uber-outstanding review as others found here on TA. I am not an amenities freak but the €160 room cost did not include breakfast and I felt the Concorde missed opportunities to deliver better value and a more satisfying experience. The hotel is top-tier enough and the basics so well done that it prompted me to anticipate “nice touches” that never materialized. Importantly, the Concorde’s rooms have complimentary internet, but otherwise, there were really no useful “extras.” Even music through the TV had a cost. A coffee station or an iPod dock, for example, would have been a nice touch. My traveling companions at the Swissotel across the street were, for the same room cost, enjoying complimentary breakfast and checking their email on free WiFi while I was scrounging around out in the cold looking for an affordable cup of coffee. The Concorde essentially offered a nice room, good bed, and clean bathroom without the thoughtfulness or value punch that would make it a standout and distinguish it above other Berlin hotel options in their price range. The Details: Front-desk service was efficient and courteous, but a little stiff. My guest room smelled good, like fresh air. It was large, comfortably decored, and nicely broken up by a free-standing wall that housed the closet, drawers, and mini-bar and served as a divider between the guest room and the bathroom. The room was equipped with common amenities, such as a mini-bar and safe plus robes, slippers, and some toiletries. No ironing board. Mini-bar prices were high but not insulting. The bed was hard but comfortable. There was no hallway noise. Room heat was manageable by opening a window. The bathroom was quite large, with separate shower, tub, and toilet room. The green marble counters and floor tile were in perfect shape but reminded me of a 1993 Marriott. My room had no view except the tip of the Kaiser Wilhelm cathedral. Housekeeping left a sign on the bed confirming they had honored my request to not change the bed linens. (Apparently, my failure to specifically request a linen change means I specifically requested no change. Odd.) I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it as a sensible hotel option in Berlin. I doubt it will knock your socks off unless you are on the Club Level. Next time I need to stay in West Berlin, I will probably try out the Swissotel to see how it compares. Hope this helps. .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in the Heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: lolainlondon
Reviews.Content: I could not have been happier with our stay at the Concorde Hotel. It's an exceptional hotel, especially for German standards. The location is perfect, in the heart of the shopping district (the Ku'damm) and very close to the underground. First of all the service is truly remarkable. German/European hotels are not exactly known for their service and this hotel proves them all wrong. They are efficient, friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms are comfortable, exceptionally large, clean and quiet. There isn't anything bad I could say about this hotel and even though we only had a one night stay, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel supported by excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ScottishAdrian
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Concorde Berlin for my birthday. Rates offered for a huge twin room over the weekend were VERY reasonable for a 5* hotel, booked through expedia. Concierge helped with advice and booking theatre tickets weeks before I arrived with charges applied to room account for no fuss. Staff are very helpful yet not intrusive. 24hr fitness studio with attached sauna, steam room, plunge pool and relaxation room offer generous facilities if you have free time. Hotel recognised my birthday and supplied a plate of fruit and biscuits, a very nice touch! Location is surrounded by restaurants, bars, shops galore, tourist attractions and many tourist bus services depart just round the corner. Underground trains are a couple minutes away and Zoologischer Garten, 5 minutes from hotel, offer direct trains to Schonefeld airport. Excellent hotel in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: wilsarth
Reviews.Content: Located in West Berlin, the hotel is still a good location for the major sights in the East part of the city. The Kurfustendamm station is close and the hotel is a 25 minute bus ride from Tegel airport. The standard rooms were very large (the bathroom was also very large), clean and comfortable. The free wifi was reliable, we were even given a wireless router to ensure we had a good signal. My only gripe with the room was that we had a double bed (two singles joined together) but with two single duvet covers, however we didn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: maybest123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights and enjoyed each one. Very grand and all shiny & new. Top class service, upgrade to a junior suite, good bar and restaurant and a very relaxed air about the place. Was a little concerned that it was not in the historical center but it mattered little as Berlin is so easy to move about. Great shopping nearby and I personally enjoyed a jaunt around the nearby Zoo. Lovely spot.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Ketling
Reviews.Content: We have visited Berlin many times before but have never stayed in more comfortable and perfect hotel. First of all, even the less expensive room was quite big, spotlessly clean and beautifully appointed with marble bath and luxury towels and cosmetics from Annick Goutal. The bed was very comfortable and you could have the linnen changed daily which we however declined with respect for the enviroment. Everything was to the highest standard, the room was very good sound isolated which is essential given that it is so close to Kudamm. From the reception to the bar the staff was really nice in a friendly and not at all in a stuffy or pretentious way as it is so often the case with five star hotels. In the bar we had the BEST Club Sandwich ever! Do try it! One funny downside: the level of light in the bar is too low for our taste, we could hardly read the menue! Also, one does get sleepy in a dark room so... it would make more sense not to dim the light so much. Perhaps people would stay longer and order more drinks ;) We can warmly recommend this hotel and we will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great breakfast, but perhaps not as perfect as reviews indicate”
Reviews.Author: BizLeisureFred
Reviews.Content: Based on the fantastic reviews posted for this hotel, our expectations were perhaps a bit too high. Get me right, it is a very good hotel indeed, but there were a few flaws. Positive things first: - The location is superb if you are considering your Berlin stay to be West Berlin only. Most of the most famous sights in Berlin are though at the border between West and East or in the East, but it is quite accessible using Berlin's excellent U-bahn metro. The shopping district along the Kurfürstendamm is just around the corner - and the lovely Berlin Zoo is less than 10 minutes walk away. - The breakfast at the hotel is a great experience. In a breakfast room that looks to be designed 1962-63 (but new of course), a very nice breakfast with good selections is served. Strong recommendation to make sure the breakfast is included in your reservation! - The rooms (also the standard ones) are spacious and modern. The bathrooms are very spacious and nicely built & decorated. Two separate sinks, separate large shower, separate toilet niche and a bathtub. Plenty of space in the corridors which small entrance niches for 2-3 rooms each ensures a very quiet experience overall. Beds are a bit hard (French style), but still comfortable. - A small gym with two small sauna available at the hotel. Nothing fantastic, but ensures a break if you need one. - Parking garage in the building ensures neat access to the hotel. 18 EUR a day is to be considered appropriate, but not a bargain. - Good rates over the weekend - and a nice family offer, giving the second room for half the price of the first one. 182 EUR for the first, 91 for the second (incl. breakfast). For a hotel of this quality (and with such a good breakfast included), it was actually a good price. Now to the flaws: - Upon arrival, there wasn't an extra bed in either of our two hotel rooms even if that was agreed upon in the reservation. I reminded the reception staff about it after check-in. Once returning to the hotel in the evening, it was still not there. One more reminder and then it eventually came. - The cleaning of the rooms were still ongoing at 5 pm at our second day. As we needed at least one room, we were forced to have to accept on the rooms not to be cleaned (not a big issue), but we've never experienced that the staff wouldn't have been ready this late in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient Trendy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurocruise
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at this central modern hotel just off Kurfusrtendamm. The hotel is very cleand with modern lines and spacious rooms. Paid the extra for Club Etoile access which was worth it with breakfast afternoon tea and evening drinks and nibbles available - loved the bread and cheese! Breakfast may be taken in the main restaurant however on the two occassions I used it the restaurant was busy with a good 30 minute wait for eggs cooked to order.Although the choice was more limited in the Club Etoile lounge the hostess was more than happy to have eggs cooked to order sent up. - nice touch! Rooms are of a good size but lack Tea & Coffee making but do have a well stocked minibar. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Five star ammenities with a warm welcoming atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: eric77_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week and the staff were very courteous. The Manager, Otto, allowed us 3 to a room , though 2 is maximmum for a small surplus, and it included the most amazing breakfast selections I have ever had. Best breakfast ever Hands down, you wont need to eat again until dinner time in short I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, with great Value”
Reviews.Author: MariaNTrondheim
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went on a five day trip to Berlin this summer. We decided to spend a little bit extra money on hotel for this trip, and I am very glad we did. (it was actually not expensive at all, if you compare it to the hotelprices we have in Norway) I found the hotel at tripadvisor and decided to use the hotel after reading reviews from other guests. The hotel is fantastic! Great service from the doormen and conceriege, and friendly staff in general. We lived in a superior room, witch I think is the smallest roomsize they have actually. The room was big and spacious, and the bathroom had both shower and bathtub. Lots of closet-space, safe box, minibar, and free wi-fi. We really enjoyed ourselfs and even though we spent most of our time in east Berlin, I am very glad we stayed at the Concorde Berlin in the west, many subwaystations nearby, and situated right next to the amazing shoppingstreet ku'damm.

Reviews.Title: “great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: KimH
Reviews.Content: Extremely comfortable room...large well equipped bathroom, crisp linens, great mattress...quiet, but with a nice view of city...located close to major metro line so easy to get around the city...great dining nearby...excellent concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, but avoid the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Doursou
Reviews.Content: Hotel Concorde Berlin successfully matches high standards of quality you would expect from an international grand hotel in a city like Berlin. Indeed, the hotel is well-located (though in West Berlin, so not close to the Museum Island), its design is classic and great while being definitely elegant, the staff is excellent. The hotel is huge, but quite well organized: the fitness center (including spa/ sauna/ hamman) is a real relief. The rooms are pleasant, with excellent and large washrooms. You get free WiFi and good beds. To start well your day, the breakfast at this hotel is definitely the first step: the choice of the buffet and the quality of the food are close to perfection. Unfortunately, this is quite not the case of the hotel restaurant: the place seems nice, and almost fashionable but, in fact, it reveals to be very expensive without serving you good dishes. At this restaurant, wine prices are almost a scam (around 15 euros for a glass of a 2009 bad French/ Italian wine). If you like to have lunch/diner without going too far, just get out of the hotel and walk 15 meters on the left: you will find Via Piano, a delicious and very cheap Italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: AthensPanos
Reviews.Content: this hotel is really wonderful,i spent there 5 nights and it was great,although i didnt like berlin,the room was like a small apartment,great from every aspect,the location very good with many shops near and a very lively area.the staff very good and a lot of computers with free internet 24 hours,great,the only thing that is missing is a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: RolfParis
Reviews.Content: I have spent a couple of days at the Concorde Hotel and must say that it was really a great experience. Wonderful large rooms, perfect bedding, well designed bathrooms, incredible breakfast and last but not least the greatest service, staff is just super. Especially manager Frank did everything to make us feel comfortable. A MUST

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, that ticked all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: alanatabz
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a weekend break with friends and weren't dissappointed! On check in, we were offered a club upgrade to rooms on the 10th Floor plus access to the club lounge for complimentry drinks, snacks, nibbles and use of at breakfast time. That was a good move! great views from the lounge and very relaxing! Hotel is very close to shops, access to the bus tours and subway for getting around. Everybody in the hotel were excellent and customer focussed. Planning on going back to berlin (for a longer stay as a weekend wasn't long enough) and this will be first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in K Dam”
Reviews.Author: joscco
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my wife last Christmas.The hotel is well located and is clean ,modern and centrally located.The staff were very friendly and helpfull and overall i can find very little to fault the hotel. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault hotel or service - fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Colejen73
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by a friendly efficient concierge who couldn't do enough to assist us throughout the entire holiday. He kindly took our bags and took us to reception to check in, where we found that our room was already available to us at 1030am. On booking the hotel, we chose to go for a superior double room. When we got to our room, we couldn't have been more delighted, It was very generous in size, nicely decorated with all of the facilities that you could need (including a well stocked minibar). The bathroom was nearly as big as the bedroom itself with a lovely shower wet room, separate bath and two large sinks, finished off with lovely complimentary toiletries. The location of the hotel is great for sightseeing and touring, located in the centre of the Western part of Berlin with public transport very close by, The breakfast buffet at the hotel was all you could wish for (and more) with a fine variety of goods to choose from, including freshly made waffles, meats, cheeses, cereals, fresh fruit, etc., etc. All in all, we could not find any fault with the hotel, the service or the staff and would not hesitate in returning ourselves or recommending the hotel to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend this hotel enough”
Reviews.Author: EBrody
Reviews.Content: I usually like going to upscale hotels throughout the US, and although I cannot compare it to any other Berlin Hotels, I was really impressed. The service is excellent, staff is very helpful, the breakfast at the Executive Club was outstanding, they have drinks and other exquisite between meal goodies throughout the day, which was great after being out walking throughout the day. It is in an excellent location both to move throughout the city and walking distance to great shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth time lucky”
Reviews.Author: emmessduesseldorf
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at the Concorde; - and to cut a long story short: I'd always come back! "There's not a lot more you could want" I wrote two years ago. Okay, so the shower still is not adjustable in height but fixed, the handwashbasin is too far away from the rim and the air condition is simply overpowering, - but the staff is super friendly, helpful and efficient, the cleanliness excellent and again and again I praise the breakfastbuffet! Forget their restaurant, never mind the bar, but you'd never forgive yourself not having seen this buffet. Berlin is not very expensive compared to other European capitols but it does have it's luxury hotels. Among those, the Concorde certainly is a bargain (for those travelling on a budget: There are always promottions).

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinn
Reviews.Content: An elegant and modern hotel in a good location (if you prefer West Berlin) with big rooms and bathrooms, airy common spaces and meeting facilities, and super friendly staff. The last time I styed in the club level (but in a deluxe suite, which was enormous, but had a very limited view). The small Club Etoile with a very nice view was adquate, perhaps the servigs a bit lmited both in quantity and also by the serving times. The staff again very friendly. The fitness center was quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with big rooms and good service”
Reviews.Author: howo72
Reviews.Content: Right at the Kudamm, good first Class Hotel with good service, fitness center and a good conference area.

Reviews.Title: “The discreet charm of Concorde.”
Reviews.Author: Gradiva
Reviews.Content: Hotel Concorde has everything for a discriminating traveler - huge room, great spacious closets lit inside, comfortable bed, striking design, excellent shower, separate bathtub, free internet, superb breakfast, convenient location, Annick Goutal toiletries, free bath robe and slippers, mini-bar pleasantly large and well-stocked. Everything was sparkling and gleaming. It was a pleasure to arrive – there is a bell-boy at the entrance to greet you and help with the bags. An additional big advantage over some other hotels claiming 5-star rating in Germany was the very helpful staff both receptionists and the concierge were attentive and knowledgeable. I had a tight train connection going to another city, and a young lady at the Front desk had a great advice to take an earlier outbound regional train to connect to ICE train at Berlin Hauptbahnhof. The concierge was excellent in suggesting taking the buses 100 or 200 to get to Berlin Gemaldegalerie and Museum Island; also explaining a U-Bahn ride to Deutsche Opera and the fare information. All the information I have received from the staff was accurate, in addition they all spoke fluent English, which turned out to be rarity in East Germany, not as much in the capital of Berrin, though. This hotel is a perfection and a great value for a 5-star hotel. A few points on critique would be - I’ve stayed for two nights and the linen was not changed on the second day with a sign "per your request we have not changed the linen". I have not requested that, however - and think they should at least remove this imposing statement. And for a hotel of this quality, they should change it by default, and leave it per request. I am not sure if the turn-down service is by default, too – learning from prior stays in East Germany hotels, I prudently requested it, and it was perfectly delivered. Being picky, there is no swimming pool - although in most hotels in Germany with pools the water is too cold to swim anyway. Overall, out of many superior hotels I’ve stayed in I must say that at 133 euro per night including breakfast flexible (not-prepaid!) rate, this hotel deserves more than 5 stars; compared to some 5-star hotels in Munich or Paris this one is shining of impeccable cleanliness, modern comforts and exceptional service. I highly recommend Hotel Concorde, and next time I will also try Hotel Esplanade Berlin for a comparison, since they have a pool and are more expensive, so I wonder what more Berlin can offer. However, I will stay in Concorde for sure since it made me so happy, and I believe the management deserves the highest praise for such an exceptionally great establishment so well-run.

Reviews.Title: “So close to Five points...”
Reviews.Author: ccrr77fr
Reviews.Content: Usually, i tend to give the famous five points only to the Elite hotels providing the highest standard of service and the most yummy food and offering a perfect design, a marvellous decoration and the ultimate comfort. However, today, i've hesitated a lot to give these 5 points to Concorde Berlin but i did not cause of a few very little details but in general, i've been more than satisfied with the great great hotel so well located in the nicest area of Berlin. My partner and me booked at this hotel and we have had an incredible deal. I was even a bit surprised how a five stars property could offer such an impressive rate and i was a bit worry. However, right away we arrived at the front of the hotel, i feel the excellent standard of service provided by a well trained staff happy to offer the best of themselves. The doorman took our baggages immediatly and the front desk officer was very nice and so professionnal. He even offered us the possibility to get upgraded in a Jr Suite or an Executive Room (with Club benefits) for just a few 50 euros more but we declined this offer since we were in Berlin to celebrate the Gay pride and we had busy outside plans. Since our room was not ready, we have been escorted to the bar for a complimentary glass of wine or beer and 10 minutes after, the room was ready and the baggages already transferred on it... Such an excellent service... About the decoration, this hotel offers a very good modern design with some statues in the lobby and the corridors, some ultra trendy paintings in the rooms and a good blend of warm colours giving you a good impression to feel in your own place away from home. The size of the room was a little bit small. However, the large windows overlooking the Kaiser Wilhelm Gedächtniskirche and the rooftops of the high class shopping area of Kurfünstendamm gives an impression of an airy room very clear and comfortable. The bathroom was large in comparaison with the room with a separate toilet, shower and bathtub, two sinks and the very exclusive Annick Goutal amenities. The equipment is very good as well and the hotel offers complimentary internet access from the room (so not often in Europe). About the room service, this is very good even if the choice is quite limited but the quality is really excellent and the prices so affordable just like the mini bar (just 9.50€ for half of a bottle of Sancerre...). So why i don't give 5 points? Simply because an automatic turn down service (you still can request for sure) would be good and some fresh fruits would be a special touch on arrival as well as a newspaper in front of the room door every morning. But there are details so easy to improve and in the meantime, you'll have the smile of this staff, one of the nicest i've seen in Europe. Down to the hotel, there is a very interesting concept of italian restaurant nammed Vapiano, very cheap and just yummy... So, let's say Concorde Hotel is maybe the best choice you can do in Berlin and i think this is the best location for shopping addicts but for clubbers as well... CONGRATULATIONS and see you next time for the 5 points...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaTraveller2010
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Concorde Hotel in Berlin. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The bedroom was roomy with a great sized bathroom. The breakfast was out of this world - so much so that people were taking photos of what was on offer! If we go back to Berlin we'd definitely go back to this hotel. Thanks Concorde Hotel and 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “A seriously good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hcorn
Reviews.Content: It is easy to find disappointing things whilst travelling ... but not so easy to do so at this hotel. We really could not have been happier. The rooms are modern, very spacious and clean. The bathrooms were new and beautifully appointed. Staff have perfected the difficult balance between friendliness and efficiency and courtesy. We had booked on the executive level, using Club Etoile for breakfast and occasional afternoon refreshments. We were travelling with children who were well received and the service at all times was simply outstanding. Whilst we were travelling with family, I would gladly come here by myself, or with my wife if travelling to Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: ABroadAbroad
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot. Our stay at the Concorde was flawless. It's a big, beautiful, design hotel with all the mod-cons. The room was relatively spacious, gorgeously appointed, supremely quiet, clean, and comfortable. It had a great bathroom, excellent temperature controls, minibar, loads of closet space, WiFi, as well as a pleasing aesthetic. In short, it was lovely oasis of calm and order to return to each night. The service was excellent. The location is decent, too, in a lovely area served well by public transport. While it's not in Mitte, where most tourist sights are, or the funkier neighborhoods that I tend to like, its locale has its own to offer: the Story of Berlin Museum and the Helmut Lang Museum (both highly recommended), Literaturhaus, the Zoo, shopping, etc. Plus there are lovely little side streets to explore with good little bars and cafes. Got a great deal via its website for a deluxe room and breakfast, which was beyond lavish -- made-to-order omelets, smoked salmon, and sparkling wine were on offer. This is not an intimate, arty hotel. But for a big hotel that's part of a group, it combines the best of boutique and luxury accommodation. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: ajack1123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as part of a group that was on business. Upon arrival we went to our room and my husband and I were given twin beds. We requested a king size bed and someone was immediatly there to give us a new room. The rooms are spacious and clean with a fantastic bathroom! The beds are a little on the hard size, but I didn't have any trouble sleeping. Anything you need the hotel is at your service. I requested an iron and ironing board and they were at my room within a minute. The breakfast is one of the best I've ever seen and the concierge is extremely knowledgable at recommending restaurants too. It's in a GREAT shopping area and KaDeWe is a short five minute walk. I would recommend to everyone to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: WIRobert
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at the Concorde Berlin was as close to perfect as a hotel stay could be. The hotel is new, modern, classy. The staff is efficient and helpful. We had booked two rooms and, at check-in, asked for adjoining rooms. The request was granted instantly. The rooms are large as are the bathrooms. There is a business center available 24 hours a day with computers, printers, and scanners. A fancy French restaurant is off the lobby, as is a very nice bar. The breakfast buffet is expensive (28 euros) and expansive- everything one can imagine and then some. (We skipped this large breakfast and went to the Gusthaus Krombach about two blocks west of the hotel where a variety of tasty breakfast choices start at just a few euros.) The building also houses a hip pasta and pizza restaurant that was packed from noon until late at night. Plenty of other restaurants are within a five-minute walk. The Concorde is located in the heart of the shopping district of Ku-damm and KaDeWe. It is about 3 blocks from a main S-Bahn, U-Bahn and bus hub. Overall, this was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Warwick333
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter, got a free upgrade to a junior suite, room was amazing and huge, had a view right across the city, service was very good, location first class, across the road from a huge department store, I would definitely stay here again, next time I am in Berlin, the only thing I could ask for is a spa though

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but no swimming pool and really hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: AntoGlen
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Concorde Berlin. The hotel is located in a pretty good area with shops and the Zoo nearby. However if I was going to Berlin again I would prefer to stay in East Berlin, as it had mcuh more character and the nightlife seemed to be much better. Overall the hotel is modern, spacious and clean but there IS NO SWIMMING POOL in this hotel and when we asked about the nearby swimming pool (as listed as one of amenities for this hotel), the hotel staff did not offer any suggestions. The only other cirtisim that I would have of this hotel is that the beds were so hard, it would have been more comfortable to sleep on the ground.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNonstop
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 828 and loved it. We only paid 104 euros for this room and was totally surprised at how extremely nice it was for the price. We booked it due to the reviews on trip advisor. Conveniently located to everything. The staff was excellent. Especially the concierge, Martin, was the best! We also had their breakfast and was totally spoiled by the end of the stay. I'd stay there again. The hotel restaurant and bar was also lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Very much appreciated both by grandfather (80) and teenager (16)”
Reviews.Author: Hobbe-Sweden
Reviews.Content: My father (80 years old) and my son (16 years old) travelled from Sweden for two days in Berlin = One night hotel stay. They both were very pleased with the standard, staff friendlyness and location of the hotel. I was also very happy because the room were in my opinion very cheap. I payed 1063 SEK for one room with two single beds. Even if breakfast was not included I think that is very good value for money. I booked the hotel through hotels.com and it worked out very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for city break in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Boocat55
Reviews.Content: My husband & I decided to go to Berlin on a short break at the end of March. We chose this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor (which so far have never let us down). The hotel is modern and clean and the rooms are spacious and well maintained. It's not quite in the heart of things from a tourist perspective, we feel you'd need to stay around Unter den Linden for that but as long as you're prepared to use the U Bahn and just stroll around, it's perfect. In fact I feel we saw more because we would just get on the U Bahn and walk and very easily make our way back to another station to make our way back to the hotel. It also meant that we saw a lot of west Berlin which we probably wouldn't have seen if we'd stayed over on the east side. The hotel is easily accessed from Schonefeld airport using the airport express train to Zoo Bahnhof station and the hotel is only a couple of minutes walk from the station. There are U Bahn stations for different lines very close to the hotel which makes it very easy to get around the city and cheaply too. Would highly recommend an evening in Zwiebelfisch in Savingyplatz which is about a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel through some lovely side streets leading off Ku'damm. All in all a brilliant trip which was enhanced by the quality of the hotel. We got a great deal on directly through the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: E_DSMT
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day stay at the Concorde. We stayed in an executive room at the club étoile level. The room was very nice, clean and huge! The bed/matrasses were amazing. Only a shame it were 2 seperate bed covers. The bathroom, with shower and bath, was outstanding as well. Also the extras were very nice: daily chocolates, bottle of water and petit-fours the first day, daily newspapers, extra soups and shower gels ... At the club étoile you can drink and eat all day long. A shame were did not spend more time in the hotel. But it was ideal after a long day in Berlin, to go to the lounge and just have drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “It was peaceful and with lots of comfort”
Reviews.Author: dravs
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place to visit and stay at Berlin. Really memorable and a best place to eat the German food. Must go with families and friends.

Reviews.Title: “typical big hotel - very nice, little charm, but MASSIVE rooms!”
Reviews.Author: braddeluca
Reviews.Content: concorde hotel was a great place to stay... but lacked a little personality and charm... very very big rooms... couldn't believe how massive they were and very well appointed. if you are looking for a stylish place (among other fancy hotels) that has all the bells and whistles within walking distance of some awesome shopping - this is it. if you are looking for a charming little place where the receptionist remembers you each morning dont worry about it. we were able to catch a cab from the train station, but if you are travelling on a budget and want to go bu public transport it might be a little inconvenient (but then again, this kind of hotel will not appeal to these travellers. all in all (especially in the winter!!!!) this is a great place to visit berlin from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service hit and miss.”
Reviews.Author: MartinSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a trade fair in Berlin. Hotel is nice - rooms are a decent size and well decorated. Hotel is missing something though - not a great deal of atmosphere going on. Service at reception was good. The bar and restaurant however were pretty bad considering this is a deluxe hotel - slow and surly. There are better five star hotels in this city. Don't go expecting a great fitness centre either - 2 running machines, a cross trainer and a few weights. Not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very clean, but beds need a review”
Reviews.Author: b13boy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last week when in Berlin for ITB. Prices were high and the hotel was full. Stayed on the fifth floor with a bit of an anti-view on the garage in front. Otherwise the hotel is great. The staff were very very good. All of them smiling all of them ready to help. Concierge was efficient and friendly, got us restaurants, changed our flight tickets etc. Really helpful. Front desk as well. Staff are really a plus in this hotel. I found the rooms nice and large and super clean. However I didn't sleep well and same with my colleague, something is up with the beds. Also the rooms could do with a better air renewal system. But the services and amenities in the rooms were great and the cleanliness was impeccable. Overall it's a great hotel, awesome location and fantastic service. With a review of the beds it would make it perfect and I would give it 5 points. The decor of the rooms was very chain like for my taste, I would prefer something with more character. But that is a personal taste.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding modern Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: lazyvictor
Reviews.Content: Fantastic five star hotel in the kudam district which is ideal location for sightseeing. The hotel is only a short walk away from a tube station, with nice designer shops all around the hotel. This was my first trip to berlin and I was delighted with the city and this hotel. Came for a 5 day break, paid a reasonably cheap price for this hotel concidering it is 5 star!! and was not dissapointed. Very quick and efficient check in, found the staff very polite and friendly. I found Berlin as a whole a friendly place which is a rarety in most cities. Our room quite large with a modern interior and comfy beds, we also had great view overlooking the main shopping street. The room was spotless, as was the bathroom. Staff were very helpful with our tourist enquiries, we bought a travelcard pack at the hotel which included unlimited travel passes for 5 days and many discounts for museums, galleries and shops which was worth the orice paid. There is a great Italian next to the hotel we ate here a few times and can highly recommend it. Overall this is a smart and modern hotel in an elegant part of the city. Ideal base for sightseeing in a great vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, very Poor bed”
Reviews.Author: andyovens
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a very good place at short distance to undergrunds and bus lines. Very big-sized room, and very big bathroom, perfectly cleaned. The only big disappoint for us was the bed. Dispite mastress was very good it is wrapped in a plastic/rubber bag to protect it. We sweated all nights and we did not sleep well. Unfortunately we realized what was the problem at the end of our stay. I recommend the hotel, but ask the housekeeper to take uot the matress protection if you experience my problem

Reviews.Title: “Hotel deserved five stars; unfortunately, the Concierge barely merited three.”
Reviews.Author: sjgjess
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the hotel, except for the fact that the Concierge seemed ill-suited to his job. He had very few recommendations for dining options, and thankfully, my fiancee and I do our research because we were able to sort out our dinners on our own. Seriously, this guy has about a 1 mile radius, and within that radius, he has roughly 4 restaurants. He suggested the same German restaurant twice, even when we explained that we had been Sauerbratened into oblivion! Then, when we called with our own Thai restaurant in mind, a place that had received rave reviews all over Qype and Lonely Planet, he instead sent us to an overpriced, mediocre Thai restaurant that must give him kickbacks. When we called on the third night, he actually wanted to send us to the chain fast-food Italian place next door - a place we actually have in Dallas. Seriously, we hung up with him with the stark realization that concierges truly are often on the take. It was a letdown in such a fine hotel, and I think he should definitely perform his due diligence and research some interesting options that require imagination and curiosity. On another note, the gym was very nice, the sauna area divine, and the breakfast unparalleled. In short, we'll stick to our own restaurant research when at the Concorde, but we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: finland__9
Reviews.Content: Very good modern hotel in central location in Berlin. Extremely friendly staff. Good breakfast. Can warmly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel beside Ku'dam”
Reviews.Author: paulbru
Reviews.Content: This is a top class hotel with a modern design edge. The bedroom and bathroom are large and beautifully furnished. The staff were very helpful, especially the concierge and door staff. It's one minute from Ku'dam with a U bahn station on the doorstep and about 5 minutes walk from Zoo transport hub (U and S-bahn, DB and buses). Free WIFI in the public areas. A small gym and a nice sauna and jacuzzi area. When everything works, breakfast is excellent. On my first day, I had to wait 5 minutes to get into an overflow breakfast room where most things were lacking (juice, croissants, fruit etc). I give the hotel credit for responding to my criticism when I filled in a satisfaction questionnaire a few days later. The restaurant is very popular in the evening and I couldn't get in without a reservation. Overall, this is a very professional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As expected, a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ReisendeMats
Reviews.Content: We arrived a bit early before check in, so our room was not ready. We left the bags to the staff and went to our Conference Center. The hotel rang us when the room was ready and had already carried our luggage to our rooms. Great! The room had vey nice interiour and decoration! The bathroom was spacious and clean! It had a Taxi stop right outside the door. Great for business travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, best hotel we´ve stayed at”
Reviews.Author: rosba
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in Concorde Berlin back in May, we must stayed that it was the best hotel experience we´ve ever had, the room is huge, the gym is great, the business center is top notch and free. The location is also great, one block away from Kunfursterdam Strasse (The equivalent to 5th avenue in NY or Champs Elysees in Paris ) it was really great. The price was not steep due to a great deal we got from the hotel web. All in All a great Experience, wish to be back pretty soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveltheworld08
Reviews.Content: This is the best service we've ever had, and we've stayed in a lot of places. The staff members are all friendly, helpful, and fast. We requested a new pillow and a router to set up a wireless network in our room, and both were brought up within minutes. Our 6 month old son came with, and he was well outfitted with a huge crib, cute bedding, robe, slippers, bath toy, and bath products. We received a small basil plant start! :) I was thrilled by the washcloths and quality toilet paper - two things I can never seem to find in Europe. The breakfast is wonderful. The doormen are super helpful, especially since we have a stroller with us. The cleaning staff called to ask what time to come clean our room, which I really appreciated since I'm both working from the room and also taking care of our son, who's napping on and off all day long. Can't say enough about this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: greymanu
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an amazing stay at the Hotel Concorde in Berlin. We booked a package via a third party provider and on arrival we were happily informed that we'd been upgraded to an Executive Suite. The suites are enormous and bigger than your average one bedroom apartment. The decor is modern and comfortable with neutral colours, dark wood and plenty of natural light and the rooms come with all the usual five star trimmings. The kitchenette with a separate fridge and espresso machine is a nice touch. The service from all the staff we encountered was friendly, helpful and unobtrusive. There was a huge variety of hot and cold foods to choose from in the buffet breakfast and, being a French run hotel, the pastries in particular were delicious. Breakfast is served through to the civilised time of noon. One of our best hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally well managed, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Roelandvdh
Reviews.Content: Berlin is our favorite city and the Concorde is more and more our second home. The rooms are large, with free internet access (also wireless) and the breakfast buffet is one of the best I have ever experienced (although we hardly ever make it since partying in Berlin is of course the best). Fitness space is not large but well appointed for a quick workout. But the best thing is the staff! The management is not visible, but all staff, from the front office to the restaurant, is really really friendly, attentive and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious in every way”
Reviews.Author: LondonNessie
Reviews.Content: The Concorde is gorgeous to the last detail. The rooms are spacious - we were lucky enough to stay on the 9th floor and had lovely wrap around windows and an amazing view. The bathrooms have a separate shower room and toilet and come packed with really nice toiletries which they add to everyday. The place is large but has a very hushed environment and is calm to be in. Staff are really helpful and multi lingual, seeming to jump between a choice of languages easily. The breakfast is fabulous - although the staff that were there on our first morning (the Saturday) seemed much more helpful and efficient than on the Sunday, when no one came to tidy up the used plates. Overall, a treat to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, top service”
Reviews.Author: Turk164
Reviews.Content: I can be very short about this hotel as it is spotless. We had a huge room with enough room to host 2 adults and 2 kids. The hotel staff has been extremely helpfull with setting up a wireless internet modem in the room so I could use my mobile Nokia device to make free voip calls. Not sure about their normal rates but for 105 euros a night you cannot get more bangs for your bug. It's location is excellent. Just stepped outside on Saturday evening to get some food from the corner (Vapiano) and noticed a very lively scenery with a lot of atmosphere. One recommendation is not to park at the hotel as you can park for half the price at the Karstadt shopping center just one street further.

Reviews.Title: “BERLIN ROCKS”
Reviews.Author: AndreasThieme
Reviews.Content: I Went to Berlin to celebrate a BIRTHDAY. The friend recommended The CONCORDE Which is just one road down from the KUDAMM, The main road in BERLIN and also close to the ZOOLOGISCHER GARTEN SUBWAY STATION. Because the hotel had a SUMMER SPECIAL it was fairly affordable for me coming from South Africa. The hotel is very modern and has most features. It is a 4 STAR HOTEL with friendly service. HOWEVER I would recommend it more to business clients due to its business centre and in room INTERNET facilities. Still it is well placed to enjoy BERLIN.

Reviews.Title: “large modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: fab4lawsons
Reviews.Content: large modern hotel with very clean cut design with very helpfull and friendly staff. the bedroom was a good size so was the bathroom, we did however find the very large bed hard.the bathroom was superb with querky ideas like the speaker in it so u can here the tv, and telephone next to the toilet . there was a well stocked mini bar but no tea or coffee facilities. The choice of breakfast was amazing. a good base for getting around berlin as on the next road you can take the city hop on hop off tour which for a first timer was a great idea to get your bearings. taxis were reasonable but we did do a lot of walking as you found lots of hidden treasures this way especially walking back from the Reichstag through the Tiergarten which would often take us 2hrs but was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: spudDorset
Reviews.Content: Ideally located off the Kurfurstendamm, close to the zoo and the Kaiser Wilhelm memorial church, the Hotel Concorde was a great base for 4 night stay in Berlin. The journey in from Schoenefeld airport was remarkably easy and took around 40 minutes on the airport express - alighting at the zoologischer garten stop and then just a 5 min walk to the hotel. The hotel was extremely comfortable and we were very impressed with the amount of space we had in our room. An interesting add-on was the statue of the terracotta warrior at the end of the landing/corridor near the suites. The breakfast buffet was extensive and varied and hot food was available on request and cooked as you waited. The adjacent resetaurant (Vapiano), whilst not connected to the hotel chain I believe, was a great place to eat, modoern decor, and reasonably priced. We chose to pretty much walk everywhere and, whilst this was a little tiring, it was a great way see the sights and get round Berlin. The open top bus tour is recommended and this can just put some of the information together to supplement the walking. One disappointment was the fact that the Egyptian Museum was closed during our visit and we were not told this until we had paid our entrance fee into the "parent" museum - not opening I believe until Oct 09. Overall - a very relaxing stay in a not expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Rare Friendliness in a German Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drcharlow
Reviews.Content: Spending a lot of time in Germany, I've become used to the extremely efficient service one usually encounters in German hotels. But overt friendliness, of the kind Americans are used to from first class service industry concerns, the Germans seem to reserve for family and friends. Not so with the Hotel Concorde Berlin. Everyone from the doorman to the restaurant workers to the front desk clerk went out of their way to make sure that we were enjoying our stay. The service in this hotel was on par with Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton which is saying a lot considering the room rate charged. This hotel is highly recommended for its modern and clean rooms and pleasant public spaces and, of course, for the fine job the management has done in training the front of the house employees. Make sure you book the breakfast package and, the restaurant was quite good for two dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly staff and great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Berrysmum
Reviews.Content: We both loved this hotel. From the minute we arrived we were made to feel welcome and comfortable. Our lack of German was no problem at all. We had a large, airy room and the most beautiful bathroom, both spotless. Air conditioning was very efficient. Even though the hotel is right in the centre of a busy area, it was quiet and peaceful. Breakfast was marvellous - an enormous selection of cheeses, cold meats and fish, cereals, breads, fruit salads, and more. There was a chef making fresh crepes, pancakes and so on - quite delicious. Attentive and helpful staff were on hand at all times. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel - you'll love it too!

Reviews.Title: “Good premium hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SumitaSingh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good and provides suitable location, being bang on the K'damm street which is a good shopping area. I had booked the hotel as being close to the ICC convention centre, which was the conference venue and primarily we had to spend the days there. Thus, upon return to the hotel the near by areas were easily accessible from the hotel. The hotel had beautiful rooms, with a good wardrode and ample storage space. I specially liked the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: daimickey
Reviews.Content: Of and on we travel to Berlin with our dog, a flat coated retriever, and enjoy the superb service in this hotel. The staff is very friendly and treat us and our dog just great. He even gets his own bottle of Evian for the night. We have stayed here for nearly 10 times now and I can only recommend this home away from home!!

Reviews.Title: “Dream hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_Copenhagen
Reviews.Content: We were 3 colleagues working in Berlin for 3 days. I've stayed here once before and coming to Berlin again the hotel was a natural choice once again. The hotel is top quality service on all areas - breakfast, comfort, service, location etc. The Hotel Concorde without a doubt lives up to its 5 star status!

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend In Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MikeAndTonia
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, superb location and very nice rooms ... Stayed for a long weekend with my Partner and my daughter, the location was great, we got a corner room vary well sized and very good service. It is the first time we order milk for the little one (in a hotel) and we are not charged! Berlin, is fab for a long weekend dont miss visiting the parks, zoo and museums; especially Pergamon ***, if the weather allows it do get a bike. Vappiano under the hotel is also great, especially after running around all day, also do try the Turkish around the block (turn right from the hotel, walk for 5-10 mins and u will c it in a corner same side as the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service in a top hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToolBergen
Reviews.Content: I had a stay here earlier this year that i was not 100% happy with everything. After this i was contacted by the manager. He asked me to give them another chance. We went back there in april and i must say that it was just fantastic. First i must give credit to the manager to care so much that he did, very impressed. I can guarantee that we and our friens and our family will come back after this. The hotel has a perfect location in Kudamn. The room we was offered was perfect. Good size and cool style. We had a fantastic breakfeast in the lounge in the 10 floor every morning, just brilliant. We had our liitle son with us(15 months) and they helped us so good with everything regarding him. It was a perfect stay in sunny Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Slippery1952
Reviews.Content: I wanted to book a long weekend in Berlin for my wife and I in a first-class hotel close to Berlin's public transport connections. After reading Trip Advisor reviews on several prime location hotels I finally decided to stay at the Hotel Concorde. The Hotel Concorde reviews were all positive with many glowing references, and I too was not to be disappointed with our 'Dine in Style Package' stay at the hotel. On arrival at the hotel we were informed that we had been upgraded from a Superior Room to a Junior Suite on the 10th Floor and reservations were made immediately for us for a table on both nights at the 'Le Faubourg" restaurant. The Junior Suite had a wonderful view looking towards the Kaiser-Wilhelm-Gedachtnis-Kirche, and was spacious, well designed and extremely comfortable. The 'Dine in Style Package' consisted of accommodation, American Breakfast, and a three course dinner for the both of us for 242 Euros per night. At breakfast the restaurant served a wide selection of specialist teas and had an excellent selection of food including a chef being permanently on hand to freshly cook a choice of omelette, eggs, pancakes, waffles and crepes. Champagne was also available for those people who like to start their day with a buck's fizz. Dinner served in the "Le Faubourg" restaurant was also first class. On the first night the starter consisted of pan-grilled king prawns on a bed of couscous, with a main course of chicken, and a apple sorbet for dessert. On the second night the starter was a salad, a main course of entrecote, and for dessert a selection of different flavoured creme brulee. This was followed by a selection of chocolates. The cost of this package might appear expensive to some, however, if one takes into account the cost of breakfast and dinner for two people would be in excess of 110 Euros per day, then the cost of 130 Euros per night for accommodation of this high standard is most certainly good value. The hotel is ideally located to Berlin's transport system and all of the hotel's staff were friendly, helpful and extremely knowledgeable about the beautiful city of Berlin. Would I recommend this hotel to others - Yes. Would I go back to this hotel - most certainly. As for Berlin, all I can say it is a beautiful city with so much to offer and appears to be constantly changing, for the better I hasten to add.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Vero_PK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern with nice décor. Room was very spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The spa was very small – one round plunge pool in center with showers around it, small sauna, steam room and relaxing room. The location was convenient, one block from a main street with shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous !”
Reviews.Author: dublin_boy
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2-night stay here for €117/night via Expedia. On arrival we were upgraded to a business class room which was simply gorgeous. The room had a cleverly designed and roomy wardrobe, and separate shower and toilet in the bathroom. The only issue we had was that the WiFi connection was slightly flaky - but then again it was provided for free, unlike most other hotels ! Breakfast was a slightly pricey €26 but was very good. There were plenty of staff on duty at all times and all of them were friendly and helpful. The feel of the hotel is very plush and stylish, far more so than their room rates indicate!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service And Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: hapeeholidaymaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the christmas period and found it was in an excellent location for the christmas markets and was really central for pretty much everything. This was really important for us when choosing the location of the hotel due to my mum's limited ability to walk any distance. So location alone was first class for us. The rooms are of a superior five star standard, very clean and modern and bedding and towels were changed every day with a turn down service at night. The bathroom was excellent offering a seperate shower and large bath with quality fixtures and fittings, again spotessly clean. We found the beds very comfortable complete with featherbed toppers and high thread count sheets and we were able to sleep really well each night of our stay. Even though the hotel is centrally located we never heard anything going on outside or within the hotel itself. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and nothing was too much bother for them. They were so helpful arranging transfers, making reservations etc for us, and the fact that neither of us spoke any german did not pose a problem due to the multilingual staff. Everyone was lovely, the bellboy, doorman, concierge, reception staff. I cannot fault any of them. We ate in the pasta place downstairs a couple of evenings which i would highly recommend, and when we return to Berlin i would definitely stay here again. The only downside for us was the lack of swimming pool, which we would have definitely used had it been there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lux Hotel in west berlin”
Reviews.Author: ArbiAthens
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during christmas for 5 days. Was very nice, clean, modern and the Hotel staff was excellent. There is also free internet including office facilities (fax, printer etc) and a small gym. The breakfast was in high standards too (there is also a chef) . I stayed in the room with 2 more friends and i have to say that was a specious room and very comfortable. There is no pool in this hotel and also the place that you can meet and have a drink was placed on the basement, means was not so pleasant to go. The hotel is situated in the center of west city Means is close to the Zoo. However is close to the bus station Nr 100 & 200 and metro station Kurfürstendamm that drives you to the east part of the city. The duration is around 15-20 minutes and the cost is from 2 - 6 euros or around 18 euros by taxi. You have to take this in consideration as most of the attractions and underground bars are placed on the east part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gave Away our Reservations”
Reviews.Author: DiBowers
Reviews.Content: We were looking very forward to staying at the Concorde Berlin Hotel. Not only did we hear that it was very nice, but the best part is that the location was so convenient to sightseeing, right in the middle of Berlin. We were excited about being able to just step outside and walk to many places. We were part of a tour, and when we arrived, we were told that they decided to cancel our reservations (which we had had for many months) at the last minute because a larger conference group had come along that they wanted to take advantage of. We are sure that they knew about the conference group some time in advance of our arrival, and so they could have given us earlier notice, but did not. I didn't know a hotel could do that! Apparently, they can just tell you that you have no reservations afterall! We ended up being sent to some hotel, originally built during Communist times, way out in the country which was awful and far away from everything. We were so disappointed. I imagine that if you were a couple or a family, there would not be as much of a chance of this happening to you. Again, we looked forward to the hotel mainly because of the location right on the main street of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Professional Serivce”
Reviews.Author: Vivre_au_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business trip to Berlin. Arrived early at the hotel and inquired about whether it's possible to get a room after spending the previous night on a plane, was given a room (on the club level) promptly. The room is very large and modern, beautiful bathroom with shower, toilet, and large tub separated by glass doors. Internet was free. Hotel staff was excellent (front desk, concierge, bellboy, doorman). Hotel is centrally located and very convenient for shopping, sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed”
Reviews.Author: Kevin-Teresa
Reviews.Content: Eventually stayed at the Hotel Concorde after much indecision but had no regrets . It is literally across the street from the Swiss Hotel but we availed of a very competitive 3 night rate on the hotel website so opted for the Concorde instead. We booked in and out with ease and all sfaff we encountered were courteous and helpful. Our delux room was spacious,stylishly decorated and very comfortable. We did not avail of the breakfast buffet which was crazy money per person but in terms of accommodation you could not fault the hotel. It is very centrally located and easy to find. The excellent Berlin transport system ensures that nowhere is too far away. Its a wonderful city and we adore the less frenetic and more genuine Christmas atmosphere it provides.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: SkunkyLeMay
Reviews.Content: First I should note that I was a female traveling alone. I wanted some place with all the amenities and good security, but also a place where I could be more or less anonymous if I wanted to be. I got everything I wanted. The staff was first rate, friendly and efficient, always kind and helpful but never uncomfortably familiar. People have remarked that the staff is great on this website and I found it to be very true. I have only great things to say about the hotel employees. My room was on the 6th floor and at night I could see the Kaiser Wilhelm church and the Mercedes sign lit up like the moon. My room was gorgeous, super clean and quite large. The bathroom was fabulous. It had both a bathtub and a shower. The bath products were Annick Goutal! There is a small gym and a business center with computers and a printer. I never had to wait to use one which was nice because I found I could not freely surf the web from my laptop in my room due to some some situation (I didn't really understand the explanation) that blocked most sites. I only mention this for informational purposes. It didn't impact my stay tremendously. Anyway, that's all. I enjoyed it thoroughly and would go back in a second. It is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “First class Concorde”
Reviews.Author: NICKIM7
Reviews.Content: 11th December 2008 Went to Berlin for the xmas markets, which are plentiful and quite enjoyable, some of them were more like eating festivals but others very good. Stayed at the Concorde which i feel is very well positioned, close to bus and u-bahn stops, plenty of good restaurants in vicinity, from the moment we got out of the taxi our stay was perfect, i could not fault the hotel,we had an executive room which is well worth the extra, staff are extremely friendly and helpful especially in the club lounge, look forward to our return. NICKIM

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: The Concorde is a modern hotel just off the main drag in western Berlin. In terms of location, it's walking distance from the Kufurstendam, a major shopping street. The location is generally quiet, although a higher floor helps minimize the street noise. The lobby is unimpressive but functional. Stayed in a basic room. It was fine for one but would probably be crowded for two (as there was only one chair). There is a flat screen TV with many channels but not much for Americans other than CNN. The bathroom is spacious, with separate tub and shower, two sinks, and nice amenities, such as bathrobes. Bed was comfortable. Internet access is free (!) and easy, although wired (they will provide a wire). You can also access the internet via many computers in the business center. Breakfast is very nice with omelet/crepe/waffle station and almost everything you could want. However, at 24 Euros, the price may be a bit steep for non-Europeans. Dinner in the hotel restaurant was very good and the service was excellent. There is also a nice bar with a spacious sitting area -- great for relaxing with friends or business colleagues. The concierge consistently recommended excellent restaurants and site-seeing. If you're here for tourism, note that the hotel is about a 20-minute cab ride from the Brandenburg Gate and other major tourist attractions. The only negative came the last day when I wanted to send some items home via overnight mail. The business center hostess had never heard of FedEx. The concierge had, but the hotel could not produce a single FedEx (or other overnight company) box. So, I ended up carrying the items with me. Overall, I would highly recommend the Concorde for business travelers and for tourists, provided you understand the location of the hotel is not near most tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “In one word: Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: stroffs
Reviews.Content: A real Gem. The room is spacious, indulging modernly furnished. The location (once U like the more upper style part of town) is great. The staff is friendly and very helpful – Martin the Concierge – is a sweetheart. Business center, steam room, room service is all of the first class. Splendid!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: nerv0usflyer
Reviews.Content: From the moment we rolled up to the door in our car (weary from our drive from the UK) we felt looked after and valued. The friendly doorman took our car and parked it safely and then we received an equally friendly reception when checking in. The room was spacious and contained all mod cons e.g. wi-fi, air con, a well stocked fridge and a huge bed. The location is great and you will be well placed to explore Berlin. There are plenty of eateries in the area or a short walk away and cater for all prices. We stayed here a year ago and it is a testament to how good it was that it has been weighing on my conscience that I hadn't yet left a review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aburel
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on Kudamm near the Zoologische Garten Rail and Metro Station, with all shopping icons arround. Vapiano restaurant is below the hotel which means a lot after sightseeing Berlin. Rooms are large, well equipped, soundproofed. Bed was excellent. Only good words about the staff, always frendly and with good advices. Perfect hotel for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: souki19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Concorde Hotel for 7 days during August 2008. The overall experience was excellent! The hotel stuff was very friendly and willing to help in any way. We booked the Deluxe Room (1 King Size Bed) and were given for free an extra bed for our 7-year old son. The room (930) was extremely spacious with huge windows and a comfortable bathroom (double wash basin - shower - bath tub). The breakfast was "royal" with an ultra wide variety of things to eat and drink. The location of the hotel was very convenient: a few meters to Kurfürstendamm, 5-mins walk to the zoo U-bahn and S-bahn and the Zoologischer Garten. Also 5-mins walk to 100 and 200 bus station on Budapesterstrasse. These bus lines take you to the most popular sites of Berlin (24 hours a day). Note: Learn about the Berlin Welcome Card and use it! Next time we visit Berlin we will stay at Concorde for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Truely 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naish
Reviews.Content: Hello Stayed in the Concorde for 5 nights in July 2008 with my wife. The rooms - very big and very clean Breakfast - one of the best I have ever had staff - very polite and helping. Also used concierge services for booking restaurants, trip recommendations etc. No film channel only CNN BBC etc. renting a movie costs 14 euros & minibar is expensive as well. but that's the same in every hotel. Location: west berlin. Near by: (walking distance) Kudam street (shopping for wealthy people) KadeVe shopping center (good for women...) Story of berlin museum (in the Kudam passage. includes a bizare tour to an underground atomic shelter built during the cold war) The "ruined curche" Buses 100, 200 right under the hotel will take you (10-15 minutes drive) to brandenburg gate, Reichstag (prepare to wait in line), Holocaust memorial, Unter den Linden (10 minutes walk distance to museums island), Alexanderplatz, Culture Center. M29 bus wil take you to checkpoint Charlie, Berlin museum, Juwish museum. One thing - the hotel rooms faces 2 streets - Joachimsta & Augsburger. Rooms facing Joachimsta are a bit more noisy at weekends nights since the succesful Maxim club is right under. No sounds of music but only some noises of croud outside the club. Our room was facing that direction and it did not bother us at all. But, maybee you are more sensetive than us. Overall: I recommend. Would gladly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tripman66
Reviews.Content: This is a chic, sophisticated hotel with a great location just off the Kurfurstendamm in Berlin. The location, on Augsbergerstrasse, means that there is virtually no noise, but the hotel is literally about 100 feet from the Kurfurstendamm. The deluxe rooms are beautifully designed and above average size for a European hotel. The bathrooms are outstanding, with separate bath, shower, and toilet. There is free internet access in all the rooms (either wired or wireless) and free use of computers in the business center. We got an outstanding value--136 Euros per night for a deluxe room in July using the hotel's website booking engine. The concierges at the hotel are excellent and knowledgeable. The front desk staff are friendly and competent. The doormen and bellmen are very friendly and polite. All in all, this is a great hotel and an outstanding value. Here are a few recommendations. First, there is a great Turkish restaurant a few blocks down Augsbergerstrasse called Haris. Second, Vapiano's restaurant, a chain of Italian restaurants in Germany, is right next door to the hotel and offers good food at very inexpensive prices (for Berlin). Third, the hotel is right at the Ku'damm U-bahn station, but it's usually better to walk the three blocks to the Berlin Zoo station, where there is a much larger selection of U-bahn and S-bahn trains.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Treatment”
Reviews.Author: breezy51
Reviews.Content: I have never been treated so poorly by hotel staff. Let me start by saying that I had pre-payed for 2 rooms for 3 nights beginning on the 9th of June 2008. We had just arrived from a long haul flight from Vancouver Canada, we were dead tired and travelling with a toddler. When we arrived at the hotel I was told by the check-in lady that there was a problem which was "nothing bad" and that her colleage was coming to talk to me. This colleage was the assistant front manager named Antje Kuschel. We were informed by Antje that the hotel had made an overbooking error and would have to relocate to another hotel in the area. All of my efforts to explain that I had booked the Cocorde because I specifically wanted a new, modern hotel with large rooms were in vain. I was told that the hotel was all full, and inspite of the fact that we had pre-paid to stay there, we would have to move. There was a convention taking place in the hotel at the time (Hewlett Packard). After buying us complimentary drinks in the restaurant, we were sent to the Streigenberger Hotel down the street where we were told that we were being given "deluxe rooms", an apparent upgrade from the standard rooms which we had booked at the Concorde. The rooms at the Steigenberger were terrible. The beds were queen sized (not the king which I had booked at the Concorde), the rooms old and tired and the curtains did not cover the window and had big holes in the blackout. None of this was the fault of the Steigenberger, they made every attempt to accomodate us and find rooms which made us happy. Antje never checked back to see if we were indeed happy or made any effort to accompany us to the new hotel. We were simply dumped there. That evening I returned to the Concorde and spoke with Antje once again. She was made aware of my unhappiness with the substituted hotel rooms. She apologized profusely and said that she would absolutely get us moved back into the Concorde the next night. I asked twice if she had our contact info, she said yes, she would get a message to us at the Steigenberger ASAP. Long story short, I NEVER heard from her again in spite of checking front desk messages and voicemail repeatedly. Two days later I returned to the desk at the Concorde in order to ask Antje what had happened and was informed that she had been off for the last two days. In my opinion, the Concorde never had any intention of attempting to make the situation right. The whole experience was horrible and ruined our trip to Berlin. This hotel seriously needs to rehtink how it handles its booking process and customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at first class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TrineNorway
Reviews.Content: We have a lovley stay at Hotel Concorde. Perfect location, just few steps away from the main shopping street in Berlin. We booked a exc room. Well worth the money. Privat lounge, where they serviced breakfest( not much to couse from, but everything tasted great, lunsj, tee and cakes, canapees wine and bev. Great service! Spacius room with a nice wooden interior and a touch of modern design. Huge bathroom. The room and of course all the hotel was very clean. Love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gpmel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and the service was excellent. The location is perfect with easy access in any point of the city. Very spacius room with a nice wooden interior and a touch of modern design. I was impressed by the huge bathroom. The room and of course all the hotel was very clean. Breakfast is also excellent for european standards. Next time I will be in Berlin i say there.

Reviews.Title: “Best 4 stars hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: FabianoDi
Reviews.Content: If you're still browsing reviews to make your decision, look no more. Very good location, excellent service, parking available. Clean and modern. The whole staff, from Maid to Manager, deserves an award. Everybody shows helpful, respectful attitude. Multilingual. Concierge recommended the hotel restaurant but since we wanted to do some walk, he mentioned a place for diner, 6 blocks away, off the touristic circuit: Die Eselin von A. Good choice! Loved the Wiener schnitzel with white asparagus. Hotel breakfast was pricey but worth it. We certainly recommend this hotel. Eva & Fabiano, stayed 2 nights during the 2nd week of May 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: jacob123
Reviews.Content: This is just a great hotel, excellent staff and friendly service. The rooms are large and very well kitted out. Very nice for a weekend break and hearty breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, great service”
Reviews.Author: colesmanu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Concorde was excellent for a one week working trip to Berlin. I stayed on the 5th floor and had a view of Augsburger Strasse, directly across from the Swisshotel. The room was rather small for my liking bt was clean. It had a distinctively modern look to it with the bed, couch, TV and bathroom. I enjoyed listening to the news through the speaker system while in the bathroom. The lobby area was also great even though I must say the statues are rather strange. You can relax with large groups of friends in the lobby, order drinks or food and just have a good time. One thing I didnt like about my suite was the bed. It was really two smaller beds joined together. Dont be surprised to see a famous person walking through the hotel's lobby or relaxing at the bar. I came across Wole Soyinka, nobel prize winning Nigerian novelist while staying there. Overall, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: thegregster86
Reviews.Content: Stayed in February of 2007, and loved it! The rooms were spotless and very comfortable, and any problems we had were dealt with VERY efficiently and politely by the reception staff. Will definitely stay here again on next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: KDZTUF
Reviews.Content: We began our Elbe River cruise with 3 days at the Concorde in Berlin. There were no disappointments. The hotel is worthy of 4 to 5 stars. It's location is not the most convenient for the tourist sights but is very close to the Underground station. Then rooms are clean and well appointed The staff is polite and well trained. The breakfast is awesome. What more can we say? A bit pricey, but so is all of Berlin. We would probably not stay again but only because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “modern way of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Avidben
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderfull stay at the Concorde. Friendly staff and an impressive design. Had dinner at the restaurant and really liked it there. The food has a french twist. The room was very spacious. Would definitily stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: vimarn
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Concorde Berlin for a long weekend, and I must say that we enjoyed it intensely. We arrived around 10 am and received a warm welcome. The room was not ready, but we could check-in and leave our luggage with the bell-captain. The hotel is new and modern, Zen-like style; the atmosphere is cool but by no means unpleasant. When we returned around 2 pm we could go to our room and the luggage was already there. The room was very spacious, stylish with a very comfortable bed and a flat screen TV. The bath room had a separate shower room, a toilet cabîn, a bath tub and two sinks with ample space to put one's toileteries.
