Our room was facing the back yard which was not so appealing, but being in a city one doesn't really bother (it was quiet). Breakfast was sumptuous and it was difficult to decide what to eat as everything looked so inviting and tasty. Service was excellent throughout the hotel, check-out efficient and corteous. We had an absolutely fabulous time at the Concorde and will certainly stay there again, the location is convenient just five minutes away from train station Zoologischer Garten. If you are looking for a good restaurant, try Bocca di Bacco at Friedrichstrasse; not cheap but great food.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels in Berlin than the Concorde”
Reviews.Author: thomasplan
Reviews.Content: I stayed a weekend in Hotel Concorde in middle of August. I booked this hotel as it was said to have the most spacious rooms in Berlin. I could not believe that the de luxe rooms really had 50 square meter. Because of all the wood and the outlay of rooms, rooms seem much smaller. Staff at reception is not friendly - more on the side of efficient - how can you enjoy your stay if you are not welcome. This seems a perfect hotel for businesspeople or groups but not for individuals. Although the architecture is phantastic, this hotel is not my No 1 choice - undoubtedly this is the Hotel de Rome. There are much nicer hotels for the money in Berlin! And Kurfürstendamm is not the No 1 location, this is Gendarmenmarkt. Here are a lot of hotels and mostly better. I would not go there again!

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: HanaPrague
Reviews.Content: We had anniversary with my husband and we booked executive room at this hotel. The stay, staff, breakfast and exe room were wonderfully. Absolutely we can recommend this hotel. Hana

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: LondonBikeBoy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the money, large, high spec, modern and trendy rooms which are spotlessly clean. Hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful, both in terms of hotel info, but also info about what to see and do in Berlin. Location-wise, it's a fair walk from the main sights in the city (apart from the cool shops, which are just a few blocks away), however to get to the main sights, you walk through the Tiergarten, and believe me, this isn't a hardship.

Reviews.Title: “really excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: armagh222
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in a suite and have to say that the room was excellent and bathroom was very clean.the food also was of a high quality and the location is the best in berlin.what really sells this hotel are the staff.i have never met staff has helpful or friendly in any hotel before.........they really want to help you and make sure everything is ok!! overall i would stay here again without a thought.i really enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: papabearCarnoustie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and it was as good as the other reviews suggest. The room (delux) was very spacious and the bathroom was fantastic. The pics, candid and on the hotel web site, are exactly what you get. No unpleasant surprises. The staff are the best I have encountered, extremely polite and will do anything to help. The hotel is in a great location with lots to see and do within a short walk. Go to the zoo, a 5 min walk away, it's a great day out. Would I go again? Without any doubt at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galson1
Reviews.Content: The Concorde is a modern hotel in a street just off the Ku'Dam. I stayed in a deluxe room and it was huge. Very well appointed,nice duvets great bathroom. Stayed on the 8th floor but this was no problem as the lifts were very swift. Great hotel to spend 3 days in, just a shame Berlin isnt a great city to spend 3 days in.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, sleek, efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Badger48
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin in August 2006 and chose the Concorde for its location (just off KuDamm, short walk from Kaiser Wilhelm Gedachtnis Kirche) and spacious rooms. Our room was vast, holding a kingsize+ double and a full-size single with loads of floor space. Fixtures & fittings to usual German high standard. The candid photos already posted tell it all. The hotel is essentially business class; some visitors might find it impersonal. Reception staff were friendly and efficient. Didnt sample the restaurant apart from breakfast which was a comprehensive hot & cold buffet. Can't think of anything that wasn't included but it seemed rather expensive (21 euros each). We would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveEssex_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the concorde for 3 nights. What can I say, relatively new hotel opened Nov 2005 and it's absolutely immaculate. Reception, large, staff efficient. Bedrooms good size, bathrooms fantastic. Large bath, separate shower room. Usual free toiletries. Place was spotless and room service did great job each day - even gave fresh robes once they'd been used, unlike some other places I've been that leave you them for the stay! Breakfast an amply stocked buffet with free champagne. Room service, efficent and great quality. what more can I say , fantastic hotel would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: samanthaOntario
Reviews.Content: Good rapor with staff from the first phone call to the end of our visit. Great hotel with comfortable,clean rooms and all the comforts to make a long stay enjoyable. Close to the Ku Damm and lots to see within walking distance and easy access to the efficient transit system. Definitely would recommend to anyone and will return on our next visit to Berlin.The buffet was pricey (22E)so went to the Department store across the street(6th floor) and had a great breakfast for 2 E. S&DZander

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeezyAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent in every way except for the building work going on. It would have been good to have been told about this. On our last morning at 7.30am I had to ring reception and ask them to get the builders to stop hammering, I was told no one was working until 9am but they would check. When they rang back they told me maybe it was someone in the rooms, I was getting annoyed and asked them to send someone to the 5th floor, which they did and the hammering stopped for another hour. The building work did spoil our 5 day stay there a little as jack hammers went throughout the day on several occasions. But I must mention the consiege he went out of his way to be helpful organising a dental appointment for my husband, booking a boat tour for us at the last minute and getting us a cab so we were on time. Overall without the building works I would give this hotel the highest rating. It was also located near the zoo station which was easy to work out and take us around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Breathe Here”
Reviews.Author: Dot
Reviews.Content: I am staying at this hotel as I write this. When I made the reservation I requested a non smoking room and had at least 4 subsequent email communications with the hotel informing them that I needed to have a non smoking room for health reasons. (If you don't like smoke you may want to stay away from Berlin!) I was given a room that did not smell of smoke but the hallway and lounge at the end of the hall were smoke infested. I called to compain and asked for a room on a non smoking floor and was told that my room was a non smoking room on a smoking floor. Needless to say I moved my room to a non smoking floor but I am still annoyed that this hotel is so insensitive to people needing or wanting clean air. The manager I spoke with was rather surly. The fron desk agents are very nice but they do not seem to want to rock the boat to assist a guest who is not happy. I am at a convention and can not get out of this hotel because of prepayment issues as well as no other hotel availability but I am not very happy at this hotel AT ALL,

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Linda77
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a central location right off the ku'damm and next to the subway station - there's a supermarket in the basement of the dept store opposite the hotel and all the nightlife and shops are so close you can walk. the room was spacious, very modern, and i loved the stripy carpet! The bathroom was huge with a separate shower and bath and the staff were very friendly. I've been to Berlin a few times and will definitely be returning to this hotel and recommending it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: so3003
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Concorde for 4 weekday nights in November as part of a lastminute city break in Berlin, travelling alone. The hotel was excellent overall and exceeded my expectations, despite the relatively high pricetag (£100 GBP per night for B&B). Arriving at the hotel in a taxi, the door staff greeted me and escorted me into the reception area with my luggage. I declined the offer of having my luggage taken directly to my room while I checked in. The check-in process was hassle-free and without incident, which I was pleased about since I'd booked the hotel (via a third party website) less than 24 hours prior to my arrival. The public areas of the hotel are extremely well-appointed; lots of money has clearly been spent on the fresh, modern decor. The room did not fail to impress - it was spacious and tastefully furnished with a large king bed, oversized writing desk, flatscreen TV, minibar and all the usual conveniences of a 5 star hotel. The bathroom opened off a separate dressing area, and was well equipped with two sinks, a large bath with shower attachment as well as a separate walk-in shower cubicle, and of course a toilet. The whole room was spotlessly clean, and I wasn't disturbed by any outside noise during my stay. Being on holiday I wasn't in the hotel that much during the day, but from my occasional return visits to drop things off I worked out that housekeeping was servicing the room at least twice daily (ie my mess was being cleared up at least twice a day!), though I didn't actually encounter any of the staff. Breakfast was a self-service buffet; it was of good quality, but it would probably have been much more economical to go to a nearby bakery / deli etc for breakfast if it hadn't been included in the room rate, than to pay the standard hotel charge. One down side to breakfast was that getting to the dining room involved walking past the conference centre, with crowds of delegates smoking in the corridor - Germany apparently hasn't caught up with us in the UK on the no-indoor-smoking front! I had room-service dinner one night, which was delivered quickly and as ordered. It was nice, but I guess I could probably have gotten a cheaper hamburger and chips outside the hotel! The business centre was well equipped with broadband internet, and provided a quiet environment to check email, confirm flight arrangements and so on. Access was by passcard and using a password supplied at reception at check-in. The concierge was also very useful for directing me to u-bahn stations, and giving advice on the quickest way to get to places I wanted to see in and around Berlin. Check-out was handled efficiently and without incident, and the door staff summoned a taxi from the nearby rank to take me to the airport at the end of my stay. All in all, a successful and relaxing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AL.COPEY
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend break from 24th to 27th of November. The hotel is only a 200m walk from Zoo Station and just off the Ku'Dam. Very convenient for shopping and the sites of West Berlin. It is a bit of a hike to the sites in the east but the hotel is close to the metro (U-Bahn). The rooms are huge and airy with full ceiling to floor windows, a king sized bed, safe, mini-bar, robes, slippers and LCD TV. Breakfast was nicely presented with a large choice (breads cold meats, cooked breakfast, champagne!!!). Couldn't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Ich Liebe Concorde!”
Reviews.Author: Beckybaker1982
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend suprised me with a trip to Berlin for my birthday and was sooooo suprised by the Concorde! To say this hotel is brilliant really is a understatement! The doorstaff where friendly and very helpful, taking the suitcases to the room before we got there! I was a bit worried before I got there as I have heard people say that hotel staff are rude, but they where nothing but helpful to us! The room was huge and beautiful, especially the bathroom! HUGE bath and a walk in shower - what more can you ask for?! we never used the resturant or bar so cant comment on those but we did have room service one night which was lovely! I was also suprised by how beautiful the city was and how friendly the people where! I would definatley recommend this hotel to others and the city. It is in a good location 5mins from the bombed church and kudam plus close to transport to the east of the city. I cant recomend this hotel high enough!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LB1985
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Hotel Concorde in August, having stayed at the Radisson SAS last year. The Hotel Concorde has been open less than a year, and all areas of the hotel look pristine. Its location, right near the Ku'Damm, is ideal for shopping, and the train and bus station 'Zoo' is only a few minutes away, offering connections to the whole of Berlin. The rooms are large, clean, light and airy, and feature comfortable beds, flat-screen TV (with around 50 channels), mini bar (expensive, as you'd expect!), three telephones (one in the bathroom), individually-controlled air conditioning, and have lots of storage space for clothes, etc. The bathrooms are also large, very clean, with a large bathtub, separate walk-in shower, two washbasins, and with a good selection of toiletries provided. The buffet breakfast was delicious, with an enormous range of options from breadrolls and jam, ham, cheese, smoked salmon, etc., to fruit and yogurts, hot food (bacon, sausages, eggs, etc) and fresh made-to-order belgian waffles (a chef is 'on standby' in the restaurant to make waffles, omelettes, eggs, etc. to order) . The hotel, which seemed to be rather busy, did not have rooms ready for us on our arrival, which meant a lengthy wait, but the staff did provide complimentary drinks and a bottle of water and selection of fruit in our rooms to compensate. Overall, staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. Free internet was provided in the Business Centre (username and password provided at the reception desk), where there are five or six computer terminals, along with a laser printer and photocopier. Overall, we would fully recommend this hotel, and very happily stay here again in future. The location is very convenient for exploring the city, the rooms and beds are very comfortable, and the extensive buffet breakfast prepares you well for the day ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Pascale-Corinne
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day trip (alas, too short!) to beautiful Berlin. The Concorde is an absolutely fantabulous hotel choice and - I'll say it right up front - the only reason I'm giving it 4 and not 5 stars is the bedding. I have back problems and prefer a soft mattress. The beds at the Concorde are firm. However, reception told me that they would take care of me during my next visit and provide some sort of cushion to go on top of the mattress that'll make it feel less hard. I was glad to hear that because I would definitely want to go back. The hotel is situated in a prime location, just steps from such famous sites and landmarks as the Ku'damm, Bahnhof Zoo, Gedächtniskirche, Tiergarten etc. Transportation is very easy from there as well. Buses, trains, and taxis, all right there. All the attractions this wonderful city has to offer (such as Potsdamer Platz, Brandenburger Tor, Museumsinsel, Gendarmenmarkt, Kanzleramt/Reichstag, Hauptbahnhof etc. etc.) can easily be reached within 10 minutes. Another wonderful pluspoint is that the hotel never felt crowded. You could keep an air of anonymity and not be "bothered" by other hotel guests. Sleek, elegant, modern design throughout. The rooms are very spacious, so are the bathrooms. Seperate shower and tub. Two sinks even in the smallest standard room (40 sq m). Nice amenities too. Very small but immaculately clean and modern wellness area with two treadmills, stationary bike, and ellipse trainer. Steam room and sauna. Tiny locker room with one shower. Complimentary fruit and water. Business center with complimentary internet access (at the front desk, you can receive a password for one of the six computer terminals). Concierge was nice and helpful, but unfortunately absent too often (that could be bothersome). One or two members of the front desk staff seem to have slept through their hospitaliy management seminar on customer relations, but overall, the personnel in the hotel was definitely very nice, polite, and helpful. Food was awesome on all occasions. Breakfast at the St. Germain offered scrumptious, varied choices (buffet with service - and they do cook up anything you could dream of). Lunch and/or dinner at Le Faubourg imaginative and heavenly delicious. Overall: wonderful experience. Can recommend it to anyone! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great home base”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one-month trip to Berlin. My husband had work in Berlin, so we took a few side trips, returning each time to the Hotel Concorde. We found that the hotel made an excellent home base for us as the staff were so friendly and helpful. We stored bags at the hotel while on each side trip, and every time we returned the bags were already in our room. Everyone was courteous, friendly, helpful and very polite. The room was large and comfortable--the bathroom was HUGE! The breakfast buffet is fabulous--lots to choose from and these great teapots that keep your tea hot the entire time. Another perk was the free use of the business center, complete with printer and copier, and the free high speed internet in the room. We absolutely enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “New location in the old heart of Western Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Concorde Hotel is situated at the famous Kranzler-Eck at the Kurfürstendamm, the old heart of (Western) Berlin. The Swissotel is located vis-a-vis, the entrances of both five star hotel are facing each other. Compared to this hotel, the Concorde might be the smarter choice. The rooms are more spacious and well equipped. No espresso machine like in the Swissotel, but a free an fast internet connection (LAN-Cable available at the quick responding concierge desk) on the rooms. Spacious and luxurious bathroom, great "open" closet and a expensive but well fitted minibar. State-of-the-art design meets a friendlly and helpfully staff. Good rates via Internet travelling-companies! You should take some minutes for searching the Internet and you will find a great value for your money. Ideal location when you have to work or visit the Western part of Germanys capital, not so good if you want to get to the political centre Berlin-Mitte. But the great and world famous department store KaDeWe can be reached within a six minutes walk!
